discussion.content:
Srnd:Cisco CallManager Cisco IP Phone Services
High availability for the CallManager Cisco IP Phone Services is obtained by using the Services Provisioning service parameter or by using an SLB device pointing to multiple Unified CM nodes running the Cisco CallManager Cisco IP Phone Services. For more details, see High Availability for IP Phone...So C is correct

choices.D: DNS A record with multiple IPs listed
choices.B: automatically handled by Cisco Unified Communications Manager
choices.A: unique phone service for each Cisco Unified Communications Manager server

questions.question_text: Which method is recommended to implement high availability when configuring the Extension Mobility phone service?

discussion.content: One option is C, but it could be and A

questions.question_text:
QoS should be configured on Cisco VCS because it processes the media and the call signaling. The endpoints that register to Cisco VCS (such as the Cisco
TelePresence System EX Series, C Series, and Cisco IP Video Phone E20) should be configured so that media uses which Layer 3 DSCP packet value?

discussion.content: The answer is LOCAL Zone but i think with default Zone implies Local Zone :P

questions.question_text: Imagine you configured several zones for device registration on Cisco VCS. To which superior zone are all of your configured zones associated?

discussion.content:
E and nothing else. It could be D without %%
The number pattern must consist of an optional + followed by one or more dialable digits (0-9, A-D, *, #), digit ranges in regular expression format (example: [6-9] or [^6-9]), or single-digit wildcards (X). The pattern may end with an optional % or !.

questions.question_text: Which two hosted directory number patterns can be configured on Cisco Unified Communications Manager for advertisement via the Call Control Discovery process in a Service Advertisement Framework-enabled network? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
my personal opinion is that

C is also wrong and is also mentioned on 300-820 official cert guide page 107,
D is correct

comments.content:
regarding, I could find only
Subzones also determine the
bandwidth restrictions to be applied on calls between endpoints, and whether calls are established
between endpoints within the same Subzone or several different Subzones.
which mentions only subzones (off cert guide
)

discussion.content:
correct answer C & D.
When an endpoint registers with the VCS, it is allocated to the appropriate subzone based on its IP address. If the endpoint’s IP address does not match any of the subzones, it is assigned to the default subzone.

choices.C: Endpoints are associated to default subzone or any customized subzone depending on the IP address of the endpoint.
choices.A: You can register endpoints to default zone.
choices.D: A neighbor zone connects Cisco Expressway Core to other systems via SIP or H.323.
choices.E: A neighbor zone connects Cisco Expressway Core to Cisco Expressway for NAT, PAT, and firewall traversal.
choices.B: Bandwidth for calls between endpoints in the same zone cannot be restricted.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about Zones on Cisco Expressways are correct? (Choose two.)
